result.execSummary:
The defendant Aron Richard Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Defendant to obtain a High School Diploma, GED or HSED during the pendency of probation term.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars except in the furtherance of employment, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No physical disciplinary or confrontational contact w/ M.R.N.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 21CF242 & 22CF13 Cases called @ 10:18 AM Defendant Aron Richard Nelson in court.  Attorney Wesley Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Melissa Louise Barrette in court for Aron Richard Nelson. 22CF13 - The Court entertains wavier of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. As to both cases - Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 21CF242: Ct 1 - NC. 22CF13 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 21CF242: Ct 2 - DRI. Uncharged Physical Abuse to a Child charge stemming from an incident occurring June 5, 2020 dismissed and read in. Statement by DE. Court orders: 21CF242 - $500 fine plus costs w/ 60 DTP or PP.  22CF13 - S/W 3 years probation - Conditions: DE to obtain a HSED or GED, AODA and follow through, DE must maintain absolute sobriety, DE may not be present upon the premises of any bars except in furtherance of employment, DE is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Anger Management and follow through, No physical disciplinary or confrontational contact w/ M.R.N., Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.

Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. Defendant stands mute. NG plea entered by the Court.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.
